title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5902.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5902.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part: (a) Foundation means the New York State

Science and Technology Foundation, with headquarters at 99 Washington Avenue, Albany, NY 12210. (b) Executive
director means the executive director of the foundation. (c) Board means the board of directors of the
foundation. (d) Applicant means any
corporation which is the subject of an application for financial assistance
under the Corporation for Innovation Development Program. (e) CID program means the Corporation for

Innovation Development Program, a program of financial assistance to new, technology-based business ventures, funded by a U.S. Department of Commerce

Special Economic Development Administration grant, and by the State of New

York, administered by the foundation. (f) Investment review committee means the
committee designated by the board to review and act upon applications for CID
program financial assistance filed with the foundation. (g) CID program manager means that member of
the foundation staff designated to oversee the CID
program. Notes

5902.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
